forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 41. Northwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 53, with temperatures falling to around 47 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 12 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock inches toward the dawn of a fresh Thursday in Boston, the night whispers cool secrets of the approaching day. With temperatures resting around a crisp forty-one degrees, the air carries a refreshing chill, as a gentle northwest breeze weaves its way through the cityscape. Stars may be retreating, surrendering to the blue-hued light on the horizon, leaving behind a tranquil stillness, unmarred by fog or haze.

The sun will soon stretch its rays across the skyline, heralding a mostly sunny and invigorating day. However, do not be fooled by its initial warmth; expect temperatures to taper off in the afternoon. The Northwest wind, with a hint of briskness, may leave you feeling a touch cooler than anticipated, nudging you to wrap a cozy scarf around your neck or slip on a warm sweater as you step outside. This day invites a stroll down the Charles River Esplanade or perhaps a quiet moment in one of the city’s parks, where nature holds the promise of autumnal beauty. As day unfolds, chosen activities might drift towards enjoying a warm cup of coffee in your favorite café, or perhaps diving into a good book in the comforting embrace of soft sunlight and shadows.
